name: Problems of Mind and Body: Meaning and Doing
base_name: Problems of Mind and Body: Meaning and Doing
long_desc: Central to our existence is meaning and our responses to it. We believe and desire things and on the basis of these attitudes, we make things happen. How can meaning exist in a seemingly mindless world How can the world give rise to a mind capable of agencyThis course tackles the mind body problem in respect of explaining meaning and human action. We tackle philosophical problems with serious engagement with empirical work from psychology and neuroscience. Students taking the course will tackle these problems with emphasis on developing analytical abilities.

custom_fields.goals: Our aim is 1 to address central philosophical questions about the nature of the mind by 2 using and developing philosophical skills for argument and conceptual analysis.
custom_fields.key_topics: The nature of the mind, the relationship of the mind to the body
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Regular argument analysis, two papers, midterm. No final.
custom_fields.relevance: Dietrich GenEd prior to Fall 2021: Deciding
